segments.en: Hello, English learners, and welcome back to EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 你好，英语学习者，欢迎回到EnglishPod。

segments.en: My name is Marco.
segments.cn: 我叫Marco。

segments.en: And my name is Katherine.
segments.cn: 我叫Katherine。

segments.en: And today we're talking about money, but this time we're talking about borrowing money.
segments.cn: 今天我们要谈论钱，但这次我们要谈论借钱。

segments.en: Right, so we're asking for money.
segments.cn: 对，所以我们在请求钱。

segments.en: We're going to the bank and we are asking for a loan.
segments.cn: 我们去银行申请贷款。

segments.en: But before we go, why don't we take a look at vocabulary preview.
segments.cn: 但在我们去之前，为什么不先看看词汇预览呢？

segments.en: Vocabulary preview.
segments.cn: 词汇预览。

segments.en: Okay, so a loan is some money that you get from the bank, so we're talking about requesting a loan today.
segments.cn: 好的，贷款是你从银行获得的一些钱，所以今天我们在谈论申请贷款。

segments.en: Alright, so you request for a loan or you ask for a loan.
segments.cn: 好吧，你申请贷款或请求贷款。

segments.en: Exactly, so to request is to ask.
segments.cn: 正是如此，请求就是询问。

segments.en: Okay, very good.
segments.cn: 好的，非常好。

segments.en: And that's the word that we have for vocabulary preview, so let's listen to the dialogue for the first time.
segments.cn: 这就是我们在词汇预览中提到的单词，所以让我们第一次听对话。

segments.en: Hello, sir, may I help you?
segments.cn: 你好，先生，我能帮你吗？

segments.en: Yes, I would like some information for requesting a loan.
segments.cn: 是的，我想要一些关于申请贷款的信息。

segments.en: Very well.
segments.cn: 非常好。

segments.en: Here are the general terms of our loan policies.
segments.cn: 这是我们贷款政策的一般条款。

segments.en: We pride ourselves in having the lowest interest rate in the country for personal loans.
segments.cn: 我们以拥有全国最低的个人贷款利率而自豪。

segments.en: I see.
segments.cn: 我明白了。

segments.en: So let me get this straight.
segments.cn: 所以让我弄清楚。

segments.en: If I borrow, let's say, $10,000, how much will I have to pay each month?
segments.cn: 如果我借，比如说，$10,000，我每个月需要支付多少？

segments.en: It depends on how long you take to pay it back.
segments.cn: 这取决于你还款的时间。

segments.en: If we lend you $10,000 at an annual interest rate of 10% for 48 months, you would have to pay each month a portion of the loan, which is called the principal, and another small portion of the annual interest rate.
segments.cn: 如果我们以10%的年利率借给你$10,000，期限为48个月，你每个月需要支付一部分贷款，称为本金，以及另一小部分年利率。

segments.en: This, of course, is considering that you don't default on a payment.
segments.cn: 当然，这是考虑到你没有违约的情况下。

segments.en: It sounds good, but there's just one problem.
segments.cn: 听起来不错，但只有一个问题。

segments.en: I have a terrible credit score.
segments.cn: 我的信用评分很糟糕。

segments.en: That is a very serious problem, you see.
segments.cn: 这是一个非常严重的问题，你看。

segments.en: The bank must assess your personal information, past loans, assets, and any other relevant information such as your credit score in order to approve your loan.
segments.cn: 银行必须评估你的个人信息、过去的贷款、资产以及其他相关信息，如你的信用评分，以批准你的贷款。

segments.en: You know what?
segments.cn: 你知道吗？

segments.en: I don't really need the money.
segments.cn: 我其实并不需要这笔钱。

segments.en: Thanks anyways.
segments.cn: 不管怎样，谢谢。

segments.en: All right, we're back.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们回来了。

segments.en: So now why don't we take a look at some of the key words that we'll find in Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 现在我们来看看在语言收获中会遇到的一些关键词。

segments.en: Language Takeaway All right, so in Language Takeaway today, we have a couple of different words.
segments.cn: 语言收获 好吧，今天在语言收获中，我们有几个不同的单词。

segments.en: Why don't we start off with the loan policies?
segments.cn: 我们先从贷款政策开始吧？

segments.en: Okay, so a policy is like a rule.
segments.cn: 好的，政策就像是规则。

segments.en: For example, a government can have policies, but in this case, a loan policy is the rules regarding the loan that you have.
segments.cn: 例如，政府可以有政策，但在这种情况下，贷款政策是关于你所拥有的贷款的规则。

segments.en: Right, so maybe the loan policies could include how long, what's the maximum length of your loan, or maybe what's the annual interest rate, etc.
segments.cn: 对，所以贷款政策可能包括贷款的最长时间，或者年利率等。

segments.en: How much you have to pay each month, like that.
segments.cn: 每个月你需要支付多少，就像这样。

segments.en: So loan policy is the rules related to the loan that you've taken out.
segments.cn: 所以贷款政策是与你所借贷款相关的规则。

segments.en: And we have some very, very important words following this, and they go together.
segments.cn: 接下来我们有一些非常重要的单词，它们是一起的。

segments.en: So the first word is to borrow.
segments.cn: 第一个单词是借。

segments.en: Okay, so you probably know this word already, to borrow.
segments.cn: 好的，你可能已经知道这个词，借。

segments.en: So can I borrow your pen?
segments.cn: 我可以借你的笔吗？

segments.en: Can I borrow some money?
segments.cn: 我可以借一些钱吗？

segments.en: Sure, let me give you my pen, let me give you my money.
segments.cn: 当然，让我给你我的笔，让我给你我的钱。

segments.en: But wait, giving is different because giving means I don't have to get it back.
segments.cn: 但等一下，给予是不同的，因为给予意味着我不需要把它还回来。

segments.en: Right, so if you want to give it to someone temporarily, then you lend them your pen, or you lend them some money.
segments.cn: 对，所以如果你想暂时给某人，那么你借给他们你的笔，或者借给他们一些钱。

segments.en: Great, so to borrow is to take something from someone, knowing that you will have to give it back later.
segments.cn: 很好，所以借是从某人那里拿走东西，知道你必须稍后还回去。

segments.en: And to lend is to give it to someone, right?
segments.cn: 而借出是给某人，对吧？

segments.en: So can you lend me your pen?
segments.cn: 所以你能借我你的笔吗？

segments.en: That means can you give it to me, please?
segments.cn: 这意味着你能把它给我吗？

segments.en: Right, and this is a common mistake with language learners, especially English learners, that they make the mistake of using borrow instead of lend.
segments.cn: 对，这在语言学习者中是一个常见的错误，尤其是英语学习者，他们错误地使用借而不是借出。

segments.en: So can you borrow me some money?
segments.cn: 所以你能借我一些钱吗？

segments.en: Right, so can you lend me some money?
segments.cn: 对，所以你能借我一些钱吗？

segments.en: Sure, but I expect you to pay me back later.
segments.cn: 当然，但我希望你稍后还我。

segments.en: Okay, very good.
segments.cn: 好的，非常好。

segments.en: And if I pay you back later, I'll include an interest rate.
segments.cn: 如果我稍后还你，我会包括一个利率。

segments.en: Will you really?
segments.cn: 你真的会吗？

segments.en: No, not really.
segments.cn: 不，真的不会。

segments.en: No, not really.
segments.cn: 不，真的不会。

segments.en: Mostly it's banks that ask for an interest rate.
segments.cn: 大多数情况下是银行要求利率。

segments.en: So in this case, an interest rate means the amount of money that a bank will charge you in addition to the money that you owe them.
segments.cn: 所以在这种情况下，利率是银行在你欠他们的钱之外收取的金额。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: So it's called an interest rate, and it's a rate because it's a percentage.
segments.cn: 所以它被称为利率，因为它是一个百分比。

segments.en: Like 5%.
segments.cn: 比如5%。

segments.en: Exactly, 5-10%.
That is an interest rate.
segments.cn: 这就是利率。

segments.en: And now moving on, if you have a loan and you have to pay each month, be careful to not default on your payments.
segments.cn: 现在继续，如果你有贷款并且每个月都要支付，请小心不要违约。

segments.en: Okay, default.
segments.cn: 好的，违约。

segments.en: In the banking world, this means to not be able to pay your loan.
segments.cn: 在银行界，这意味着无法偿还贷款。

segments.en: So that means that if I owe $1,000 to you, Bank of Marco, and I don't have the money, I can't pay for it, then I default.
segments.cn: 所以这意味着如果我欠你$1,000，Marco银行，而我没有钱，我无法支付，那么我就违约了。

segments.en: So to be late or to not make the payment.
segments.cn: 所以迟到或不付款。

segments.en: It's a verb, to default.
segments.cn: 这是一个动词，违约。

segments.en: Very good.
segments.cn: 非常好。

segments.en: And Will, the person asking for the loan has a small problem.
segments.cn: 而Will，申请贷款的人有一个小问题。

segments.en: His credit score is not very good.
segments.cn: 他的信用评分不是很好。

segments.en: Okay, I think he calls it terrible.
segments.cn: 好吧，我想他称之为糟糕。

segments.en: And one of the ways that you get a terrible credit score is by defaulting on a loan.
segments.cn: 而获得糟糕信用评分的一个方法是违约贷款。

segments.en: But it also means that maybe you borrow money or you have credit cards and you can't pay off your bills.
segments.cn: 但这也意味着你借钱或有信用卡而无法偿还账单。

segments.en: And so a credit score is very important in America and it's like a report card for your finances.
segments.cn: 所以信用评分在美国非常重要，就像你的财务报告卡。

segments.en: Right, so for example, if your credit score is a report card and you have an A credit score, that means that the banks won't have a problem with lending you money.
segments.cn: 对，所以例如，如果你的信用评分是报告卡，而你有A的信用评分，这意味着银行不会有问题借给你钱。

segments.en: Or if you want to buy a new car, it'll be okay.
segments.cn: 或者如果你想买一辆新车，那也没问题。

segments.en: But if you don't pay your bills on time or you default on your loans, then maybe you'll have a C or a D and then people will not really lend you money in the future.
segments.cn: 但如果你没有按时支付账单或违约贷款，那么你可能会有C或D，然后人们将不会在未来借给你钱。

segments.en: They won't trust you.
segments.cn: 他们不会信任你。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: Alright, so that's credit score.
segments.cn: 好吧，这就是信用评分。

segments.en: That's all the words we have for Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 这就是我们在流利构建中提到的所有单词。

segments.en: Why don't we listen to the dialogue again and we'll be back shortly.
segments.cn: 我们再听一次对话，稍后再见。

segments.en: I see.
segments.cn: 我明白了。

segments.en: So let me get this straight.
segments.cn: 所以让我弄清楚。

segments.en: If I borrow, let's say, $10,000, how much will I have to pay each month?
segments.cn: 如果我借，比如说，$10,000，我每个月需要支付多少？

segments.en: It depends on how long you take to pay it back.
segments.cn: 这取决于你还款的时间。

segments.en: If we lend you $10,000 at an annual interest rate of 10% for 48 months, you would have to pay each month a portion of the loan, which is called the principal, and another small portion of the annual interest rate.
segments.cn: 如果我们以10%的年利率借给你$10,000，期限为48个月，你每个月需要支付一部分贷款，称为本金，以及另一小部分年利率。

segments.en: This, of course, is considering that you don't default on a payment.
segments.cn: 当然，这是考虑到你没有违约的情况下。

segments.en: It sounds good, but there's just one problem.
segments.cn: 听起来不错，但只有一个问题。

segments.en: I have a terrible credit score.
segments.cn: 我的信用评分很糟糕。

segments.en: That is a very serious problem, you see.
segments.cn: 这是一个非常严重的问题，你看。

segments.en: The bank must assess your personal information, past loans, assets, and any other relevant information such as your credit score in order to approve your loan.
segments.cn: 银行必须评估你的个人信息、过去的贷款、资产以及其他相关信息，如你的信用评分，以批准你的贷款。

segments.en: You know what?
segments.cn: 你知道吗？

segments.en: I don't really need the money.
segments.cn: 我其实不太需要这笔钱。

segments.en: Thanks anyways.
segments.cn: 不管怎样，谢谢。

segments.en: Alright, we're back.
segments.cn: 好的，我们回来了。

segments.en: So now why don't we take a look at three key phrases on Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 现在我们来看看流利构建器上的三个关键短语。

segments.en: Let me get this straight.
segments.cn: 让我理清一下。

segments.en: We're going to do Fluency Builder?
segments.cn: 我们要做流利构建器吗？

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: Wait, I don't... wait.
segments.cn: 等等，我不... 等等。

segments.en: So, okay, this is our first phrase.
segments.cn: 好吧，这是我们的第一个短语。

segments.en: Let me get this straight.
segments.cn: 让我理清一下。

segments.en: And this is a fixed phrase that means we always say it the same way.
segments.cn: 这是一个固定短语，意思是我们总是以相同的方式说它。

segments.en: Wait, let me get this straight.
segments.cn: 等等，让我理清一下。

segments.en: We always say it the same way?
segments.cn: 我们总是以相同的方式说吗？

segments.en: Right, so you're asking for a confirmation or you're repeating what that person said just to be sure that it's correct.
segments.cn: 对，所以你是在请求确认，或者你是在重复那个人所说的话，以确保它是正确的。

segments.en: Exactly, so maybe you don't understand something or maybe you think you might have misunderstood.
segments.cn: 正是如此，也许你不理解某些事情，或者你认为你可能误解了。

segments.en: You say, hey, so let me get this straight and you repeat what the person just said.
segments.cn: 你会说，嘿，让我理清一下，然后你重复那个人刚刚说的话。

segments.en: It's a way for you to, like you say, get confirmation on what you've heard.
segments.cn: 这是一种方式，让你确认你所听到的内容。

segments.en: Very good.
segments.cn: 非常好。

segments.en: Let me get this straight.
segments.cn: 让我理清一下。

segments.en: And now moving on, we have the phrase pay it back.
segments.cn: 现在继续，我们有短语“偿还”。

segments.en: You have to pay it back.
segments.cn: 你必须偿还。

segments.en: Okay, and so in this case we have the verb to pay, but we also have the word back.
segments.cn: 好的，在这种情况下，我们有动词“偿还”，但我们也有“回”的词。

segments.en: So pay it back means to repay.
segments.cn: 所以“偿还”意味着还款。

segments.en: So if we take out a loan, we obviously have to pay it back to the bank.
segments.cn: 如果我们借了贷款，显然我们必须偿还给银行。

segments.en: Right, so you have to pay the loan back.
segments.cn: 对，所以你必须偿还贷款。

segments.en: Okay, so just remember that these words often go together, to pay it back.
segments.cn: 好的，所以只要记住这些词通常是一起使用的，偿还。

segments.en: I'll pay you back, I promise.
segments.cn: 我会还你钱，我保证。

segments.en: Right, can you lend me a dollar?
segments.cn: 对，你能借我一美元吗？

segments.en: I'll pay you back tomorrow.
segments.cn: 我明天会还你。

segments.en: Ah, don't worry about it.
segments.cn: 啊，别担心。

segments.en: Alright, and the bank started off saying, we pride ourselves in having the lowest interest rate in the country.
segments.cn: 好的，银行开始时说，我们以拥有全国最低的个人贷款利率为荣。

segments.en: Yeah, right.
segments.cn: 是啊，没错。

segments.en: Alright, so we pride ourselves.
segments.cn: 好的，所以我们以此为荣。

segments.en: What does it mean if I pride myself in something?
segments.cn: 如果我以某种方式自豪，这意味着什么？

segments.en: The word pride means to be really happy about something that has to do with yourself.
segments.cn: “自豪”这个词意味着对与自己有关的事情感到非常高兴。

segments.en: So something that you're proud of is something that you want to tell a lot of other people about.
segments.cn: 所以你引以为豪的事情是你想告诉很多其他人。

segments.en: So for example, a father may say, my son just got straight A's and he's an excellent soccer player.
segments.cn: 例如，一个父亲可能会说，我的儿子刚刚得了全A，他是一名优秀的足球运动员。

segments.en: And so he's proud of his son.
segments.cn: 所以他为他的儿子感到自豪。

segments.en: But to pride oneself means to be really happy with the way that you do something.
segments.cn: 但“以某事自豪”意味着对你做某事的方式感到非常高兴。

segments.en: Right, so for example, if I've never smoked, right?
segments.cn: 对，所以例如，如果我从未吸烟，对吧？

segments.en: So I can say, I pride myself in being a non-smoker.
segments.cn: 我可以说，我为自己是个不吸烟者而感到自豪。

segments.en: Or I could say, I pride myself in always saving lots of money for my paycheck.
segments.cn: 或者我可以说，我为总是为我的薪水存很多钱而感到自豪。

segments.en: Very good.
segments.cn: 非常好。

segments.en: So it means I try to do this because I know it's a good thing.
segments.cn: 所以这意味着我努力做到这一点，因为我知道这是件好事。

segments.en: But you feel very good about this and you feel that people should be proud of you as well.
segments.cn: 但你对此感到非常好，并且你觉得人们也应该为你感到自豪。

segments.en: So we could ask our students here, what do you pride yourselves in as a challenge?
segments.cn: 所以我们可以问我们的学生，你们以什么为自豪作为挑战？

segments.en: As a challenge for the website.
segments.cn: 作为网站的挑战。

segments.en: Alright, so why don't we listen to the dialogue for the last time and we'll be back.
segments.cn: 好的，为什么我们不最后听一次对话，然后我们会回来。

segments.en: Hello sir, may I help you?
segments.cn: 你好，先生，我能帮你吗？

segments.en: Yes, I would like some information for requesting a loan.
segments.cn: 是的，我想要一些关于申请贷款的信息。

segments.en: Very well.
segments.cn: 非常好。

segments.en: Here are the general terms of our loan policies.
segments.cn: 这是我们贷款政策的一般条款。

segments.en: We pride ourselves in having the lowest interest rate in the country for personal loans.
segments.cn: 我们以拥有全国最低的个人贷款利率为荣。

segments.en: I see.
segments.cn: 我明白了。

segments.en: So let me get this straight.
segments.cn: 所以让我理清一下。

segments.en: If I borrow, let's say, $10,000, how much will I have to pay each month?
segments.cn: 如果我借，假设，$10,000，我每个月需要还多少？

segments.en: It depends on how long you take to pay it back.
segments.cn: 这取决于你还款的时间。

segments.en: If we lend you $10,000 at an annual interest rate of 10% for 48 months, you would have to pay each month a portion of the loan, which is called the principal, and another small portion of the annual interest rate.
segments.cn: 如果我们以10%的年利率借给你$10,000，期限为48个月，你每个月需要偿还一部分贷款，称为本金，以及年利率的另一小部分。

segments.en: This, of course, is considering that you don't default on a payment.
segments.cn: 当然，这是考虑到你没有违约的情况下。

segments.en: It sounds good, but there's just one problem.
segments.cn: 听起来不错，但只有一个问题。

segments.en: I have a terrible credit score.
segments.cn: 我的信用评分很糟糕。

segments.en: That is a very serious problem, you see.
segments.cn: 这是一个非常严重的问题，你看。

segments.en: The bank must assess your personal information, past loans, assets, and any other relevant information, such as your credit score, in order to approve your loan.
segments.cn: 银行必须评估你的个人信息、过去的贷款、资产以及任何其他相关信息，比如你的信用评分，以便批准你的贷款。

segments.en: You know what?
segments.cn: 你知道吗？

segments.en: I don't really need the money.
segments.cn: 我其实不太需要这笔钱。

segments.en: Thanks anyways.
segments.cn: 不管怎样，谢谢。

segments.en: Alright, very good.
segments.cn: 好的，非常好。

segments.en: So as you say, saving is important, and well, sometimes, do you think you need a loan?
segments.cn: 所以正如你所说，储蓄很重要，有时，你认为你需要贷款吗？

segments.en: I think sometimes people need loans because they want to go into business, for example.
segments.cn: 我认为有时人们需要贷款，因为他们想创业，例如。

segments.en: So people who want to go into small businesses or open their own companies need startup capital.
segments.cn: 所以想要开小企业或自己的公司的人需要启动资金。

segments.en: And so this is a really great example of when people don't have the money lying around and will go to find a bank that will give them a loan.
segments.cn: 这真是一个很好的例子，当人们没有多余的钱时，他们会去找一家愿意给他们贷款的银行。

segments.en: So yeah, I think it's really important, especially for the economy of a country, for business loans or small business loans to be available because sometimes it's very difficult to find a bank that will actually lend a person money to start a business.
segments.cn: 所以是的，我认为这非常重要，尤其是对一个国家的经济来说，商业贷款或小企业贷款的可用性，因为有时很难找到一家愿意借钱给人们开公司的银行。

segments.en: Usually they won't have a problem with lending them money to buy a new car.
segments.cn: 通常他们在借钱给人们买新车时不会有问题。

segments.en: But to start up a business, it's completely the opposite.
segments.cn: 但要开办一家公司，情况完全相反。

segments.en: It is.
segments.cn: 确实如此。

segments.en: And one of the really popular trends in foreign investment right now is called micro-lending.
segments.cn: 目前外资投资中一个非常流行的趋势叫做小额贷款。

segments.en: So micro-loans.
segments.cn: 所以小额贷款。

segments.en: And that means that if I want to help people in a very poor country, I can donate, I can lend $100 for someone to buy a sewing machine.
segments.cn: 这意味着如果我想帮助一个非常贫穷的国家的人，我可以捐赠，我可以借出$100给某人买缝纫机。

segments.en: Or for someone to buy a small computer, $500 for a small computer, and that is a micro-loan.
segments.cn: 或者借出$500给某人买一台小电脑，这就是小额贷款。

segments.en: It's a very, very small loan for one thing and that can help them towards their goal of being a business person.
segments.cn: 这是一个非常非常小的贷款，可以帮助他们实现成为商人的目标。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: And you're not really getting money out of it, though.
segments.cn: 但你并没有真正从中获得金钱。

segments.en: You're not charging like 100% interest rate.
segments.cn: 你没有收取100%的利率。

segments.en: You're not.
segments.cn: 你没有。

segments.en: You're charging like 1 or 2% interest, very low interest, and you're giving people a chance to pay the money back because it's such a small amount.
segments.cn: 你收取1%或2%的利息，非常低的利息，并且你给人们一个偿还的机会，因为金额如此之小。

segments.en: Wow, that's really good.
segments.cn: 哇，这真的很好。

segments.en: A really positive thing.
segments.cn: 一件非常积极的事情。

segments.en: Very good.
segments.cn: 非常好。

segments.en: So if you have any questions, any comments, or any suggestions, please come to our website at EnglishPod.com and we'll see you guys there.
segments.cn: 如果你有任何问题、评论或建议，请访问我们的网站EnglishPod.com，我们会在那里见到你们。

segments.en: Bye, everyone!
segments.cn: 再见，大家！
